I'm still a paying customer and now paying more because I'm on a monthly plan - I don't mind that, but I don't ever see me signing up for a 2 year contract again.This is not how I would treat any of my customers, and this has reflected poorly on me professionally.The fact that LW have admitted fault is what frustrates me so much.I would expect a re-fund, or future credits that would cover my costs.

Review.Titre: Total disaster in migrating my emails…
Review.Contenu: Total disaster in migrating my emails to Liquid Web.  I won't give all the gory details but the process ultimately failed because they migrated all of the emails for one account, some of the emails for another account, and none of the emails for two other accounts.  After than they stopped responding to the help tickets.  I lost a week of my life for nothing, because I need to go back to my former email provider.After a delay, I eventually received considerable support by 3 or 4 well-qualified technicians who helped me solve essentially all of my migrations problems.  The Liquid Well server is working smoothly now, and I am glad that I am with Liquid Web.  I am therefore changing my rating from 2 starts to 4.

Review.Titre: v poor webmail and they even…
Review.Contenu: third class webmail and they even charge for it.I have to speak out about it.for years, we have been paying the liquid web fee for a mail service which is so poor, it's unbelievable.The search does not work.UI is ancient.There is no app or calendar sync they do offer hosted exchange mailboxes, which are pricier.and on top, their email server IP addresses get black listed and then our emails won't reach the destination.when we asked by opening a ticket, they had no resolution time frame.

Review.Titre: Inordinate delays in migrating a web server
Review.Contenu: I have been with WiredTree and then LiquidWeb for 11 years. They have been fantastic all those years. This time the experience has been poor. I needed to migrate to a more powerful server and change my OS from CentOS to AlmaLinux. I needed everything set up by July 5 morning. I signed up and paid for a two-year plan on July 1, Saturday night. I was told that the new server would be set up in minutes and that the migration would take another 24 hours. However, the tech support's attempt to provision a new server failed. They said the issue had been passed on to the "development" team, and that someone would get back to me soon. I don't think the tech support can set up a server, and they knew no one from the development team would be in until July 5 to set it up. I expected an honest and realistic timeline. All I got was multiple tech support folks passing the tickets to each other. As of now, NOTHING has been set up. I am unsure if LiquidWeb is having financial problems and is short of staff or whether they have cut down on technical staff, hoping the customers will not notice. However, the marketing staff has contacted me in the meantime to discuss plans. I notice that the tech support now aggressively markets security plans. This tardy service and false disclosure are not the LiquidWeb I knew. Not sure if they are having financial problems internally or if the investors are now demanding higher returns. The tech support staff I get for other issues seems competent and helpful. However, this poor experience setting up a new server and migration has left me wondering if I should demand a refund and move to another host.

Review.Titre: Knowledgeable staff has already left LiquidWeb
Review.Contenu: The knowledgeable staff has already left LiquidWebPROS: Friendly support (mostly). Uptime is very good, close to 100% or should I say almost 100% most of the time. There used to be some guys that are very knowledgeable and were willing to make the extra step to help you out on tricky issues, although the knowledgeable guys seem to no longer work there.CONS: The billing charges one's card without notifying in advance on what exactly the amount will be charged, thus price increases can surprise you. And tricky extra charges are also a shocker.Very expensive for what you get.LiquidWeb automatically enrolls you in auto-pay via credit card or your bank account (direct debit) via Paypal, so they can charge your card or withdraw any amount directly from your Paypal account and if your Paypal acc. has zero balance then from your bank account! And you are unable to remove your bank account number from their records! They won't accept bank wire or manual Paypal balance payments, so you're stuck providing LW either your credit card or Paypal/bank account for them to help themselves in your account for any amount.Made a 2 year deal with a fixed amount paid to LW but a year after I paid for 2 years LW is already charging me extra money on the balance despite the agreement and prepaid hosting for 2 years. One year after the deal they stopped sending me zero invoices via email, but started sneaking in extra sneaky charges of unknown unidentified origin. When asked what those charges are the billing department gives some smoke and mirrors answer.The live chat constantly closes from lost connection. Can't even save the chat transcript. Or the chat will get stuck for hours in waiting being never attended.There's a lack of knowledgeable staff since most of their best staff has already left the company and you can read about that on the internet forums. The support will for days conveniently ignore more complex issues they were able to fix in the past and only address issues that are simplest in nature, but usually reply is written that there's nothing they can do about it, leaving customer stranded looking for help elsewhere or moving to another, more modern, knowledgeable and more flexible host.Simple questions they were easily able to answer and address now are repeatedly ignored, even if asked twice, just to confirm things.The best days of LiquidWeb heroic support and fair billing are clearly over. I am looking to move elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Rubbish support
Review.Contenu: I have been working for a client for the last month who is hosted with Liquidweb and been having major problems with email being sent from the website/server due to it being badly setup to begin with.Liquidweb have been a complete nightmare in trying to get this resolved, they have caused even more problems, refused to help fix issues they caused, given bad advice and made the whole situation worse.The IP address on the server had a bad reputation and was blacklisted. So I fixed all the issues on the website that were causing spam, and asked Liquidwebweb for a new IP. They refused, so no way to fix the issues without outgoing mail being rejected.I then discovered they had sold the client various other services they didn't need or know how to use, including the business email, which they had never setup for them.So I moved all their email from their server to the business email service and got everything working.Liquid web then blocked the mailbox that was being used to send email from the website, causing more problems.We got the mailbox unblocked, liquidweb support, and insisted everything was working, but we still couldn't send email.Finally they admit they had actually blocked the entire server/IP from sending email through the business email server completely due to the bad reputation of the IP.Yes they were blocking their own IP from one of their own servers, which they had refused to replace, causing this situation in the first place.So we switched to using a 3rd party SMTP relay service (mailersend), but this was also failing, because liquidweb had actually blocked all outgoing SMTP from the server to anywhere.So we have an e-commerce site that cannot send email to any customer using any method because liquidweb have blocked everything and won't do anything to help and won't give us a new IP.Now in process to migrating site to a new provider.

Review.Titre: I paid for private server hosting
Review.Contenu: I paid for private server hosting. I expected good support, at least. They not only take forever to respond, they clearly don't listen and have canned answers. They broke my site by editing files and didn't bother to check. When my site goes down every time I try to update their answer is, "Oh, looks like it's up" and then don't try to solve the problem. Terrible. Not worth it.

Review.Titre: Run in circles
Review.Contenu: I was told, you gotta do A, then we'll help.I did A.Oh we won't help, you gotta do B.I do B.Oh we won't help, you gotta do C.A rational person would have likely done C, but they could have easily started with do A+B+C, I just felt like I was being run in circles.  I had no reason to think, hey if I just do C they'll help, they lost my trust by then.

Review.Titre: They are very very unresponsive and…
Review.Contenu: They are very very slow  on their ticket (customer service). You have to keep calling them over and over for their customer service to help you out with your ticket issues. they say they are Backed Up! They would need to hire more customer service for ticket issues. I been waiting for over 24 hour now and my clone is still not done, I had to call them over again to start working on it again.

Review.Titre: Look elsewhere
Review.Contenu: 2 months ago, this review would have been 4-5 stars. As you can see from other long-term clients, the quality of service has fallen drastically. As an agency, we've lost clients due to downtime and errors made by Liquid Web. Sadly, we've been lied to and that's something that's hard to come back from.

Review.Titre: not ready for prime time but now they are!
Review.Contenu: someone hit the button for automatic SSL/Certificate and wasted our certificate for exchange mail server. Now we have to solve that problem. I find features on the account that aren't available, only a promise for future completion. the support desk hasn't solved any problems for me yet.FOLLOW UP RESPONSE: My first experience with LiquidWeb was less than satisfying, but they have proven themselves to be top notch support as I learned through my later interactions with them. They do a good job and I am glad I migrated to the Liquidweb Host. I think we will be here a long time. thanks

Review.Titre: We were with them for years and they …
Review.Contenu: We were with them for years and they were great but now they just stink.  We have had outages the last two weeks and not one of their reps can solve the problem.  They are fast to respond which is good but I would rather company that takes ownership of a problem and solves it in full.  They will probably be taken over by AWS if they don't go back to giving good service with stable servers.I also warned them at least 3-4 times that I would review them if they didn't fix our issues and each time they said it was fixed only to have it break hours later.

Review.Titre: I moved to liquid web with 3 dedicated…
Review.Contenu: I moved to liquid web with 3 dedicated servers early in 2019. Less than 2 weeks after I moved, I requested a look at a PCI scan via the helpdesk as I had been told it was NO PROBLEM after asking extensive questions. However, my salesperson either lied or fully misunderstood the information she was relaying back and forth... NOT SUPPORTED. I raised hell and she came up with a compromise of pasted the report in to a helpdesk ticket. I agreed, moving clients is no joke across 3 dedicated servers. Now less than a year later they will not even honor the workaround.Aside from that the service is adequate, not fast support and certainly not the most experienced, but adequate.

Review.Titre: Support quality has declined
Review.Contenu: I've been with Liquid Web since 2016. In the last two years, support has gotten worse. They promise 24/7 support, and they do answer the chat quickly, but the engineers who can actually fix things work much more limited hours. At the same time, the technical abilities of the average support person seem to have tanked. This has meant that seemingly simple fixes now take hours to fix when they used to take about 10 minutes. Today it took them three hours to renew the expired SSL certificate that they improperly installed in 2019 and still haven't really fixed. It used to take them 10 minutes to renew the certificate. During those three hours, my customers rightly complained that they couldn't access the info they had paid for. I'm now looking for another hosting company.

Review.Titre: Lying sales & poor customer service
Review.Contenu: I've had nothing but trouble with LW, the sales person on live chat said he wanted to speak to me on the phone to offer me a deal, which I found out wasn't recorded so he could give me free extras (that I didn't even want)He got his commission then I got charged 100's of dollars more as they're not free extras.My account manager promised a refund on these services and has now just ignored me for the past 18 days, I haven't had a refund.One of the services I got conned into was a security tool, which they claimed would stop and viruses, I never had a single virus flagged with it, yet manually found some, and had some flag up via Wordfence, so the extra tools we're also useless anyway.They get 2 starts instead of 1, because the servers themselves are very good, as long as you don't need support.There control panel for the billing area is by far the worst I have ever come across in my entire web development career.They are not cheap, and the support is terrible, so there is no real reason to use this company, they have absolutely no USP.

Review.Titre: Dedicated Servers: Good infrasturcture, Bad customer service.
Review.Contenu: May 2020: Update. The support is just awful. I had a problem with one account on a dedicated server going down. It took 3.5 hours for someone to respond and they had made a minor changed and asked if I had fixed it myself. It's now been a week, they have changed the settings back on the account so that the sites sometimes loads quickly and sometimes hangs.  This is exactly what I was going thru last year.  I will send 3 numbered questions and get one response about a change they made while answering none of my questions.  It often takes days for them to respond and then I resort to opening a new ticket in order to get them to respond to my initial ticket.  Based on their replies, there doesn't seem to be any ability for the people that work there to look over the past information from the ticket.  I'm sure that's not the case, but that's what it seems like.  I'm now shopping for a new data center.  Liquid Web is completely unreliable in times of need.  I asked in a previous ticket and was told that if the server goes down, they should be able to get to it in 30 minutes.  Totally unacceptable!April 2019: Their infrastructure is great. Their customer support used to be better.  Now my tickets are shuffled from tech to tech, getting different answers from each one.  If I ask more than one question, they don't all get answers.  Ticket history doesn't seem to be read.  If you keep pushing you can get somewhere. It just takes work on your end.

Review.Titre: I expected more from Liquid Web
Review.Contenu: I have been with Bluehost and MDDHosting. I do not recall spending so much time with their support (although to be fair--they each had their issues or I would not be here now). I was recommended last year to give Liquid Web a go. I wanted to hand the entire migration process off to someone on my team. It did not happen, as it was complicated. I am a technical person to a certain degree, but not enough to have avoided a tenuous migration process. This was last October. There were then a variety of different issues that were resolved until we hit a recurring one this past summer. I was on chat with a support person who told me I should take them up on their "only one day" left spring server special! She said it would stop the issues I was having. It was double the price monthly. I agreed as she gave a lot of credence to the upgraded server being something I could rely on. I have my payments each month automatically deducted from my credit card. I do not always check the credit card. Long story short, I had been charged for the old server the last few months. In speaking with their tech team after blowing a fuse. I was informed they keep the old server going until I tell them I want to get rid of it. Unfortunately, NO ONE informed me of this at all. NO ONE. Not the person who sold me their spring special, no one since then--nothing. My responsibility is that I did not check my credit card statement. Their responsibility is when you have people who work for you and they sell a client into something new, they should also tell the client that they will continue to have the old server and be charged for it. I did not go through this at the other server companies, as the monthly cost of 99.00 is what I paid for one year at MDD and about half what I paid at Bluehost annually. For a client who did not have the background or experience with moving servers within a company this was not cool. You need to inform your clients when YOU sell them a new item. I was given one month of a refund, instead of the past few months. Had I not noticed my credit card statement, it could've gone on even longer. I do not and have not used the old server (again I had no clue that I could since no one felt the need to tell me). I gave two stars, because they are expedient in tech response, though some of the issues I have had took quite awhile to be fixed. I am grudgingly looking to move server companies again. Ugh, but I seriously am not down for the attitude of customer service at Liquid Web.

Review.Titre: Poor Service and Communication
Review.Contenu: This review is a tad long, but I assure you it is worth your time. I am convinced that most poor reviews are written in a frustrated and heated moment, however, my review is going to calmly explain my full situation so that you can make an educated decision for yourself.I own a small web design and hosting company. As a start-up we used self-managed VPS machines to host our client websites. However, we found that most of our time was dedicated to system administration rather than the business itself and so decided to find a company we could partner with to manage the overall support for system/server side of things. In other words, they handle the server and we handle our business. Unfortunately, from day 1 it was nothing but problems with their customer and technical support.We purchased a 1 year pre-paid plan (bad idea since they have a NO REFUND POLICY). We asked if we could use Plesk instead of cPanel with our server. They said it was impossible to use Plesk and use the server OS we had. This was not true since we were using it on another server just fine. After about 30 mins of transfers to different level technicians, they finally agreed it could be done. We then asked for them to install CloudLinux and we went through the same charades to get it approved. Once it was approved they added a $20/m fee, even though a personal license is only $14 from CloudLinux directly. Since I had my own license I asked if I could just use that instead and they refused. Obviously an upsell tactic, but poor service in my book.After the server was all established we were assigned an Account Manager since we were considered a part of their "Partners" program. The Partner program is nothing more than a few videos and write ups on basic web hosting and server management. However, you apparently have access to a Dedicated Account Manager and a free WHMCS license. At first, these two things caused me to feel valued in our pursuit to build a relationship with another company. However, I requested the WHMCS license several times and never received an answer. My account manager was also difficult to get a hold of and gave empty promises when I asked to expand our relationship.As an example, they had a new years sale and we decided that it was a good time to expand our capabilities. We contacted our account manager and asked if we could upgrade the server we had just purchased and pay the difference for the upgrade since it was less than 30 days. This would have resulted in doubling our initial investment with them. He agreed and asked me to contact sales and let them know that he approved it. I did as instructed and not only was I told he did not have the authority to approve it, the representative was short and rude. I attempted to get a hold of my account manager to discuss the issue again and he never responded back.During this time I was charged $70 with no explanation. I opened up a chat to discuss the charges and they said they had to elevate it to a ticket. I waited 4 days without a response and had to open up another chat to get it looked at. It was "corrected" and funds credited to my account, but still no explanation of why it happened, what was corrected and only half the charge was credited. A month passed and I was not billed for anything, however the following month I was billed for $20. I asked for an explanation and they said it was the CloudLinux fee. I explained that during the process of installing Cloudlinux I asked to be taken down from Fully managed to Core managed, which was reflective in tickets/email and lowered the price. They said there was no record of the conversation, even though I had it in my email as proof.To conclude, I am patient and reasonable, but Liquid Web has poor communication among themselves and overall poor customer service. I will say I had one tech that was excellent when installing Plesk but overall as a company, go elsewhere. Sadly, there are more issues but I have limited space left...

Review.Titre: Better in the past.
Review.Contenu: I've been with Liquid Web for more than 10 years and in the last two years the support quality has changed. Depending upon who picks up your ticket you might get a knowledgeable engineer, or someone that is barely able to identify and correct your issue. I am very disappointed with the way renewal is handled. Instead of providing you a path to a 1 or 2 year upfront payment option with discount, they make you wait until your current contract expires to determine your new pricing.The invoices always say zero dollars in email. You have to open your management interface to find out what was paid and how much was paid. I have discovered mistakes from time to time that were only caught after I closely checked my invoices online each month.Recently they upgraded a system on a Weekend late at night and almost immediately I started receiving high load warnings every hour at the exact same time. When I called in for support the technician tried to tell me it was an issue with memory and suggested I upgrade my server. I hung up on him, and called back. The next tech said there was an issue on their end they were working on but would not share the details and insisted on creating a ticket. He failed to create the ticket after I ended the call.When I did not receive the ticket and called back again and this time the tech told me straight up that an upgrade to their backend had broken backup disc storage and was creating the issue. He did issue a ticket, unmounted my storage, and then I waited a week for a correction.I still want to believe in LW and continue my hosting with the company, but these annoyances have left me pause to consider other VPS providers. I have many clients I setup on their own LW VPS offerings and I manage their sites on those servers. This obviously creates excess service hours when multiple VPS's are affected by a backend upgrade. Currently I rate them 3 of 5. They need to be more consistent in the support department, more transparent in billing, and come up with a way of addressing renewal offerings before the end of each annual contract expiration. In that they are not a low cost provider compared to their competition they do need to address these issues to keep long time customers from jumping ship.

Review.Titre: The experience of passing the ticket…
Review.Contenu: The experience of passing the ticket between multiple techs was a bad experience.  Repeated steps each time I got a new person and LONG delays in the whole process.  Other than that, the work was completed as expected.

Review.Titre: Hosting and technicians are great but…
Review.Contenu: Hosting and technicians are great but sometimes I receive no response from sales staff for days or weeks. They become impossible to get any response from, miss meeting, and ignore you. It is disrespectful. Other than that issue, their service is fantastic. I have used LW for many years and I recommend you do to.

Review.Titre: Avoid if you can
Review.Contenu: Edit: At the least, the supervisor did his best to recover from their mistakes. So two more stars.But these should not have happened in the first place.I am not satisfied with their services. It is such a messy and disorganized support team. Why?1) They constantly ask me to buy SS+ or Threat Stack. On each ticket. It is like you are being spammed constantly on your own tickets that you open.2) SS+ package previously broke my site. So we discussed with one of their team members to EXCLUSIVELY avoid disabling set_ini function. After several confirmations, I gave them the green light, and they STILL disabled the set_ini3) It does not stop there. I opened another ticket to cancel LimitLoginAttempts rules because I found a plugin that does the job. Then first, my .htaccess file got broken, and then user.ini file broke down due to a setting included PHP 7.2, which does not even exist on the server!!!While all of this is happening, sales are plummeting, and traffic is dropping organic traffic is suffering.These are not professional guys; it feels like just a few bunches of kids playing behind computer screens. And I must add the "account manager" is a joke. He just evaporated, not able to follow up anything.I am not migrating only because it was a big hassle to migrate and introduce my website to another company. But I think I will have to do that soon.OLD review: I am not always having the best experience, but their support is really dedicated and hard-working.

Review.Titre: Good communication but no result
Review.Contenu: Quick summary: paid by PayPal. Told have to produce two ID documents for "Fraud Prevention". Didn't want to. Refund ok - but seems to take a week. Don't understand why they took the money before the checks rather than the other way around.Detailed narrative: I paid them a substantial sum of money. They took the money from my PayPal account and started demanding that I send them two forms of government Photo ID to actually provide the service I had just paid for. They said this was "Fraud Protection" but very odd then that they went ahead and took the money before seeing my ID. If they thought it was a possible fraud surely they should have done the checks and then taken the money? I lost all trust and cancelled.It is important to clarify in response to the claims from LiquidWeb below that a) I paid by PayPal for the hosting which is an available payment option and b) despite saying this was a fraud protection measure they took the money from my PayPal account before checking my documents. They then refused to provide me with the already paid for service until I had provided the documents. The phrase «Liquid Web cannot take payment from your PayPal account» I don't quite understand. I have a PayPal statement showing a payment from my account to LiquidWeb! Perhaps they can explain this?(As a side note they demanded that I send the documents by insecure email as open jpegs - not even a password protected archive).Update! Ok. I sent the money from PayPal; they didn't «go into the account». I don't think this is important. The point I want to make clear to readers is that they said «Fraud Protection» - but they took/I sent (via their PayPal integration which they set up) the money Before they saw the ID documents. They then refused to provide a service before seeing two government photo IDs. Just be aware that this can happen(Hopefully - final update. The refund it seems can take several days. Though the payment to them seems to have been instant. This means my funds are tied up for days).Update! I paid with bank account not a card but perhaps that does not make a difference.But - let's not lose sight of the main point!!!! - If Liquid Web had not taken/received the payment Before blocking provision of the service for "Fraud Protection" we would not have been in this position. This is my point. They should not take funds and then raise further demands to provide the service. If they want to raise further demands they should do this, give the client the choice, and only take the funds when they are actually going to provide the service.

Review.Titre: AI support
Review.Contenu: I had my sites on LiquidWeb for little over 6 months and had to open countless tickets for a number of issues which included sites randomly going down; redirects not working etc. What I truly disliked was that support was slow; it never fully solved my issues (it always took another ticket to find out there was an extra step to go through to get things properly fixed, and I only would because I asked and pressured for an answer); and support felt like a cheap AI or bot rather than actual humans. I was glad to move away.

Review.Titre: Thank God for Kohl
Review.Contenu: I give this rating a three because it took over a week to resolve my issue. I was struggling and had to work with MULTIPLE people at Liquid Web to get resolution. HOWEVER, in the end, I finally got to a man named Kohl. And he...was...AMAZING. He solved every issue that others couldn't and did it quickly. He had instant resolutions to issues, was kind and helpful and was a genuine pleasure to work with. I do like having this company as my hosting service. And my issue was very complicated. A lot of techs tried to help me. But Kohl stood above the rest. I just wanted to commend him on his professionalism and REAL expertise.

Review.Titre: Handle with care and demand that coodination and communication.
Review.Contenu: The LW sales person takes no responsibility when there is any problem. That's how it is when you are a "small" account anywhere.  It was a rough start but things are improving now that I have found a few people I can trust. Make a checklist demand that they maintain communications and coordinate with you on a migration. Don't just trust and wait.  Rackspace priced me into non-profit status after almost 20 years so I had to move.

Review.Titre: Save your money and avoid this hosting
Review.Contenu: Save your money and avoid this hosting. I'm the one who have experience of their cloud sites (cloud based hosting). This is one of the worst hostings after Godaddy and Dreamhost. 1. No filemanager2. Always issues with files and folder persmissions - need to contact their support to flush/update it, otherwise you can't rename, remove, edit or delete it from FTP, which is your only access3. First byte speed and overall SEO scores are low here.4. Support is Ok-ish, no as much experienced, but very fastAdded Later: Unfortunately there isn't any way to reply.Small correction: we have >50 websites hosted on your hosting and these permission issues are not continued issues on the same site. This is issue that we have an all websites that we host with LQ.

Review.Titre: I had my subscription transferred to…
Review.Contenu: I had my subscription transferred to Liquid Web from Rack Space when Rack Space decided to sell off their Cloud Hosting service.I noticed the difference immediately - a poorer customer interface for managing sites and poor webmail. However, hosting was reliable and I continued using their site for a few years.Gradually, the costs started rising - and it was only when they started charging for mailboxes that I started to think about ending my contract with Liquid Web.The customer service was quite good by industry standards (or at least up until December 2018 when I left). However, I get the impression this company at some point for some reason or other decided they needed to squeeze extra money out of their existing customers while not providing anything extra in return. I'm pleased I moved on.

Review.Titre: Formerly a very happy customer with…
Review.Contenu: Formerly a very happy customer with WiredTree. A shame LiquidWeb totally destroyed the trust I had with WT after their takeover.  Look around and you can see many other negative reviews from former WiredTree customers. Perhaps it is because they have grown so big and focus more on larger enterprise clients.After migration I got the same level of hosting performance but much less pro-active support.The biggest issue is they continually raised prices on my plan till they were over 70% more expensive than my previous WT bill, all over 1 year. The billing team is extremely slow in responding to requests and has very poor handover with the tech team.I'm leaving 3 stars for their stable hosting platform. However I find LiquidWeb is way overpriced for the level of performance and support they provide. I've just terminated my contract and am enjoying a superior level of performance and service from my new host, at a price less than 1/3 of what I was paying for my previous VPS plan.

Review.Titre: Four Stars--Keep Up The Good Work
Review.Contenu: I like the fact that it seems that most of the customer service reps with whom I've interacted are native speakers of English.  Also, have I told you how much I love the fact that I can actually call you guys on the phone?  (The chat feature is a little less than satisfactory, which is why I gave you four stars instead of five.)

Review.Titre: I have mixed feelings about Liquid Web. Excellent support but high costs.
Review.Contenu: I have mixed feelings about Liquid Web. We've been a customer since 2012, and the technical support is excellent. I don't know any other hosting provider that provides that kind of support. It is the reason we stay. However, the high costs, CAD to exchange USD and sales is not good. This year, we have been hit with several price increases with Liquid Web, and with the dollar exchange is becoming painful. We endured a 60% increase in our monthly cost without any notice, and ongoing price increases this year.LW could offer us no discounts as a long-time customer.  The costs on all their services are extremely high at premium rates now (with the CAD dollar). We stay, only because of the excellent support, however, moving hosting providers is always on the back of our mind now.

Review.Titre: I am happy with the experience so far
Review.Contenu: I am happy with the experience so far. It was daunting migrating my old server and setting up my new one but support played a big helpful role in it. Looking forward to using my server when my busy season starts...real soon!

Review.Titre: The continued support is appreciated.
Review.Contenu: Liquid Web has helped us transition from a legacy hosting environment to our own VPS. Even though this process has taken a lot of staff hours we are please with the support we continue to receive along the way.

Review.Titre: On this issue the first tech gave up…
Review.Contenu: On this issue the first tech gave up and said there was nothing that could be done which was disappointing. After calling and getting another tech on the phone he solved it with in a few minutes while on the phone.Since Covid the tech support has been hit and miss so I can't give a 5 star rating at this time. Prior to Covid the support was top notch. Hopefully it will someday get back to that level.

Review.Titre: You're always helpful!
Review.Contenu: You're always helpful and we always get the resolution. The only reason I didn't put full stars is that it's hard to know WHEN something will get addressed, and the waiting without knowing is painful sometimes.

Review.Titre: Issue was resolved.
Review.Contenu: Issue was resolved.Not sure if initial proposed solution did the trick or final solution by the last rep.

Review.Titre: Two years of managed hosting
Review.Contenu: LiquidWeb hosted my web server for two years. Startup was simple, and the live chat and phone support were very helpful each time I needed assistence. I would have gave five stars, however my main concern is clarity of pricing and billing. When I signed up I had no idea that I would not be able to pay the same rate in the next billing cycle, so  when the price increased three-fold, and I had spent two years saving, I realized I had no choice but to move on. This also took place in the cPanel email, and I'm not sure whose fault it is, but they said it would increase annually and then I started getting monthly bills for five dollars. To me, the word annual means yearly, not monthly. I don't want to blame LiquidWeb for this. It's all good. In the future however, I would rather see paying, returning, long time customers receive the discounts instead of new members. I must say that the support team has been excellent. In all the two years I did not have any downtime that was unscheduled, and my connection speeds were best. There is a lot of behind the scenes management that was taken care of for me by the technical staff here at LiquidWeb, also, and for that I recommend anybody looking to start a business or corporate website to use LiquidWeb. If you are like me, and just want a fileserver to share photography and homemade music with friends, maybe get something more budget friendly.Thank you for reading this review.

Review.Titre: I got patient help.
Review.Contenu: I got patient help.However, it seems liquid web has outsourced its help desk and time will tell if the reason I host there remains.

Review.Titre: Grass is not always greener on the other side.
Review.Contenu: I originally gave a two-star review and have revised it for the following reason: Although I think they need to improve their trans-atlantic communications over all for the money, I really didn't realize how good I had it. I attempted to migrate to another data center, and what a nightmare by comparison.

Review.Titre: great support
Review.Contenu: great support, small bit of advice -not all customers are IT people so keep in mind that we don't know what you know. walk us slowly through he process.

Review.Titre: Good Support Staff and they know what…
Review.Contenu: Good Support Staff and they know what needs to be done. Fast Service too.

Review.Titre: I appreciate all the help and…
Review.Contenu: I appreciate all the help and assistance we where given and the responsive time frame, as I know what we where working with winacme is technically not supported but as these are newish servers and we didn't have to go though this before and it only happening on the one sever its questionable to what root cause of the issue just wish there where some guides from liquid web outlining the way to fix the issue not some google articles though getting it fixed was the priority

Review.Titre: I've been on Liquid Web for a few…
Review.Contenu: I've been on Liquid Web for a few months now for networking. It's an extremely friendly and welcoming space with tons of business owners and services. I've met some wonderful people and have been doing business with them and we have been supporting each other's businesses. I would highly recommend Liquid Web if you're a beginner business owner, a small business, or if you're just looking for services or to network.

Review.Titre: Memory issues on my managed server…
Review.Contenu: I had memory issues on my managed server, even though current traffic was low. Ted and especially Brian found and corrected several configuration problems which radically improved the situation (and Brian continues to monitor). Early stages, and Covid has decimated my travel site traffic, but support fresh eyes has so far produced notable results.I have deducted one star because I consider some of these configuration issues should have been picked up before given the server is managed.

Review.Titre: Generally OK but seem to be focused too…
Review.Contenu: Generally OK but seem to be focused too much on acquisitions and not enough on existing customers.  Technical support is usually good, but it used to be ALWAYS good.  From Best In Class to merely above average.  My Sales account rep is disinterested.  I don't think there is a better choice, however - at least not when also considering the hassle of moving.

Review.Titre: Liquid web has always been good on…
Review.Contenu: Liquid web has always been good on support. At times, they have gone above and beyond based on the request. Keep up the good work. Knowing that they have folks with good knowledge and willing to help no matter how dumb the question may be is comforting. thank you.

Review.Titre: Watch this space!
Review.Contenu: Updated review...trying to work through customer service issues

Review.Titre: Migration of Custom Web Application
Review.Contenu: Just completed migration of our custom application to Liquid. So far I am very impressed by the quality of the VPS as well as the technical support. And the willingness of the team to go the extra mile to help with this migration. I took away one star because of the final synchronization one tech was not very careful and overwrote some of the settings that we had configured as part of the testing phase. Fortunately another tech was able to help correct the issues and we are now up and running. Looking forward to a long lasting relationship with Liquid Web.

Review.Titre: Excellent
Review.Contenu: My online program has received several upgrades and as usual had several programming glitches that needed the attention of Liquid Web technicians. They were timely in getting back to me and expedient in solving the concerns. The only reason that I didn't give 5 stars is that I don't always understand their lingo and would appreciate when possible to break down their explanations to lay terms - otherwise they are excellent.

Review.Titre: We do Like your service a lot
Review.Contenu: We do Like your service a lot. The only reason I give 4 star is, the speed. It seems the server speeds could have been increased more. Most of the sites due to server cranks runs slow. But if I oversee that, you guys are awesome. And I must appreciate your customer support, they are awesome.

Review.Titre: The Support Team is exceptionally great.
Liquid Web has been a great partner!
Review.Contenu: Liquid Web has been a great partner for us. We are a small agency with no server admins/techs on staff so we rely on their availability and competency often but especially in panic scenarios when a client's site is down or we have technical questions outside of website development.

Review.Titre: Great Customer Service
Review.Contenu: The support staff at Liquid Web is available 24 hours every day. Wait time is usually very short or non-existent (I usually use the live chat and not calling on the phone). The support staff are always friendly and courteous and will stay on the case until your issue is solved.

Review.Titre: Major Migration
Review.Contenu: We just recently migrated around 35 websites to 2 dedicated servers at LiquidWeb. The migration included a legacy Wordpress multisite network and Michael was extremely helpful in getting this over and discovering that this pre-WP 3.0 multisite does not have the same built-in redirects that subsequent versions of WP include, and is likely causing the bugs we've never been able to pinpoint. (Every developer that has worked on it assumed it was something we couldn't find in our configuration). Our sites now run about 10X faster post migration. Thanks!

Review.Titre: They care about their customers.
Review.Contenu: After a terrible customer service experience, they went out of their way to try and do the best to make up for it.  It's still a little concerning that their weekend support is not as available as expected, but they did really try to make it better.

Review.Titre: Managed WordPress Liquid Web is highly…
Review.Contenu: Managed WordPress Liquid Web is highly recommended for site speed, performance and reliability. If you have outgrown WPEngine and/or want more features but not ready to moonlight as a system administrator, you cannot go wrong with Liquid Web.

Review.Titre: A rough beginning
Review.Contenu: A rough beginning. There were multiple oversights in the setup of my environment. Including software that was never applied to my environment, incorrect software licensing, broken networking configurations (On both the hardware firewall and software firewalls), missing backups, and more.  All of which was clearly listed in the contract that I signed. It took nearly two weeks before the environment was even safely usable, after I was billed for my VMWare cluster.    It was disappointing that there was such a lack of quality control on an enterprise grade service. However, the technicians have been getting it all resolved and the environment is now working well, despite the rough start.

Review.Titre: Support has been great as usual
Review.Contenu: Support has been great as usual - but no one has been able to explain why Manage is not allowing SSL certificates to be renewed and added. Hence the 4 star and not 5 star.

Review.Titre: Good hosting company.
Review.Contenu: I have changed this to 4 star because support did fix the issues (migration from cpanel to siteworx) in a very professional manner. The staff are really good. The issue I still have is their ticket system. While they have 50 some second guarantee of a response to the first initial ticket (which is great) I waited 15 hours for a reply after the support person finished their shift. And so it goes. The ticket system does not maintain any sense of urgency after the person finishing a shift is replaced. I feel this is an LW systems issue rather than support staff. It has been like this for years and is my only real problem with LW. Otherwise their a great company to deal with.

Review.Titre: The best tech support team
Review.Contenu: Superb & effective resolution provided always by the great customer support reps!

Review.Titre: Liquid Web is awesome and if you need…
Review.Contenu: Liquid Web is awesome and if you need to call them they are there to help at anytime and also if you need them to they will walk you through what you need to do..Awesome group of people.. I highly recommend them..

Review.Titre: If Only Liquid Web Could Do This One Thing.
Review.Contenu: I’ve been using Liquid web for several years now. I would probably give liquid web 3.7 stars if I could. Overall, I’m somewhat pleased, however I’m not over-the-top happy. Like most businesses that provide service, it all depends on who you get. I’ve had many positive experiences with support admins that know their stuff and can do some good troubleshooting. However, I have also had a good number of interactions with support admins that are not experienced and have wasted my time. My most recent interaction was with one of the most knowledgeable and helpful Liquid Web admins I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with. His name is Scott Bixbey. If Liquid Web could clone this guy, they would dominate the market. Until that day comes, support will always be hit or miss.

Review.Titre: Great service
Review.Contenu: Great service. The biggest problem I have is the lack of inventory for exactly the same spec dedicated cloud servers, so when we need to spin up more we can't always get the ones we need.

Review.Titre: Great service at a fair price
Review.Contenu: You may have to push a little, but they really will help you with any issues. Great service at a fair price.

Review.Titre: thank!
Review.Contenu: thank!Fast service. Price norms. I liked the support. Quite good conditions. Server norms.

Review.Titre: Good hosting and support
Review.Contenu: Since starting our website design business nearly 10 years ago (and we host 95% of our clients) we have been through 3 different hosting providers. The first 2 began well then went downhill. Both gave stellar live chat support initially, but, as they grew, the response times got worse as did the service once you finally connected. With the last one, I regularly got stuck in the "swamp" for 10, 20 even 30 minutes before being connected.On a friend's recommendation I changed to Liquid Web about 5-6 years ago and haven't looked back. I've done at least 2 if not 3 hardware upgrades as my needs changed and they've always been extremely helpful. And all this wonderful support does NOT come at a premium cost. I've found their pricing to be extremely competitive and their support outstanding.I unreservedly recommend them as a single site host or someone, like me, who wants to buy space to host numerous sites.EDIT: As of today - April 30, 2019 - I have removed a star. My PCI scan failed due to a quite outdated OpenSSH on the server. I have had to pay $75 for them to upgrade their software on my server. Not on. I have no control over the software installed. Despite paying a reasonable amount for my server setup, this is the sort of thing cheap hosts do - using outdated software.Had this been less critical to my business, I wouldn't have altered my review; however, begin fined every day I'm out of compliance, then being charged not to be fined is not my idea of great support.

Review.Titre: Victor did a great job to get it…
Review.Contenu: Victor did a great job to get it sorted. Many thanks V

Review.Titre: A good hosting service for small…
Review.Contenu: A good hosting service for small businesses.

Review.Titre: Service is acceptable and order is fast.
Thanks for your good support and…
Review.Contenu: Thanks for your good support and service.

Review.Titre: Always great technical support!
Many thanks to Kohl
Review.Contenu: Many thanks to Kohl!  Remarkable experience this morning.  Kohl was extremely knowledgeable and helpful.  He was able to quickly identify my needs, address my immediate concerns, and make recommendations for future growth and EOL of some current products we're using.  Because of his expert advice and explanations, we made some overdue changes and upgrades to the account.

Review.Titre: LiquidWeb support is almost always…
Review.Contenu: LiquidWeb support is almost always great.  But a recent  experience with Krissy from support was stellar.  She went the extra mile to make sure the issue was completely corrected, communicated everything to me, and took the time for pleasantries which made me feel like I was dealing with a human rather than a robot (like so many other places).  Great job!

Review.Titre: Site restore
Review.Contenu: We're able to completely restore the website from a previous state. great job!!

Review.Titre: I have had a dedicated server with Liquid Web
Review.Contenu: I have had a dedicated server with Liquid Web for over 3 years. I stay with them because of their quick and responsive customer service. No matter what time of day or night, I can get quick help with any website or server issues I may have. I have had dedicated servers with several companies in the past. Liquid Web takes care of me.

Review.Titre: Super-speedy, friendly, professional resolution - again!
Review.Contenu: My request for help was met inside a minute by the wonderful Fred. I am constantly astounded at the speed with which LiquidWeb's helpful humans respond, and then work speedily to resolve my issues. Fred's help, and his constant speed of reply greatly helped to reduce my levels of stress. Fantastic service.

Review.Titre: Completely Satisfied
Review.Contenu: I have been with Liquid Web for over two years and loved their uptime and service.  They responded quickly to service tickets on the few times I have had to use one.  I upgraded to a larger VPS.  The migration started slow (about three weeks) due to some confusion and clarification of which control system to use.  Once I called Michelle at support, she immediately recognized the problem and brought Robert into the picture.  Robert went to work and had our old server completely and perfectly migrated to the new one in a couple of hours.  He was patient and answered all my questions.Thanks again, Liquid Web, Michelle and Robert.  Best VPS service available.

Review.Titre: Liquid Web truly are the most helpful humans in hosting.
Review.Contenu: The level of support that Liquid Web provides is hard to comprehend without experiencing it. It's also hard to describe. The variables involved in optimizing and managing your site can be enormous, depending on the complexity of your site. Liquid Web is a partner with you throughout the life cycle of the project, providing assistance at every step. They are also a fantastic resource for educating and empowering you to do a better job in every aspect of managing your site, from design and development to DevOps, server management and security. They will take care of you.

Review.Titre: LiquidWeb has been great for us
Review.Contenu: LiquidWeb has been great for us. The people are very friendly, extremely helpful, and help to make sure everything is done right. I recommend wholeheartedly.

Review.Titre: Fast Service
Review.Contenu: No wait, once I contacted customer support my issue was solved in minute's. My experience with Liquid has always been good.

Review.Titre: I started using Liquid Web servers over…
Review.Contenu: I started using Liquid Web servers over 10 years ago to host a dozen sites requiring both cPanel and Plesk. Their support staff have been patient, understanding, and extremely helpful in solving both major and minor issues of server stability and security. Their recommendations for improvements to server efficiency and security have provided greater peace of mind and allowed me to focus on growing my business.

Review.Titre: I am their client for almost 10 years
Review.Contenu: I am their client for almost 10 years, and in this time I convinced many of my clients to do the same. The support is brilliant, the products are simply great.

Review.Titre: Amazing support
Review.Contenu: I am very grateful to Liquidweb for their care and support, especially Steven Davis. Thank you all.

Review.Titre: The Tech was knowledgeable and…
Review.Contenu: The Tech was knowledgeable and explained things in terms clear to me.The Issues was fully resolved.

Review.Titre: Linux Tech Support Review
Review.Contenu: I recently talked with a member of Linux Tech Support, Alex Silkin, and he helped me solve a major technical issue. He was very patient with me on the phone and was very knowledgeable about the issue. I really appreciated his patience and understanding as I have never faced this problem before. We covered a lot of things during our phone conversation. Not only did he resolve the issue, but he also explained some important concepts to me in a very clear manner. Liquid Web is very lucky to have Alex on the team!

Review.Titre: I trust Liquidweb engineers to support my business.
Review.Contenu: Liquidweb engineers have been responsive and on-point with their willingness to investigate and troubleshoot even complex issues. For as long as I have been a customer, they have been only a phone call, ticket, or chat message away. I don't expect people to work as hard as I do, but Liquidweb is there like a trusted engineer working by my side.

Review.Titre: I've worked with hosting and vps…
Review.Contenu: I've worked with hosting and vps companies for 20+ years. Never have I had service like what I've had from Alex. We've inherited a site on a vps and are working through some tech debt and support has been amazing at helping us fix problems. Instead of "you should change your config here", or worse "you should check your config", support has identified and fixed multiple issues for us. And fast. Some were legit infrastructure issues but some would have been punted back to us with limited help with other companies. I'm impressed.

Review.Titre: Always there when you need help fast
Review.Contenu: Our company depends on this server for business, and our users connect at all times of day 24/7 via Remote Desktop.  When a user noticed after hours that the connections were failing, and even could not connect, I put a ticket in to find out why.  Our support tech Fred Luke was able to get us back online with 10 minutes.  When I recommended Liquid Web to the company owner, he trusted my prior positive experience with them.  Liquid Web continues to shine with awesome support, and it is always above and beyond expectations!

Review.Titre: Outstanding Tech Support Experience
Review.Contenu: Tech Support person I dealt with on my ticket had a positive attitude throughout handling my ticket, responded with a pleasant demeanor and went above and beyond in making certain that my issue was dealt with in a professional manner.

Review.Titre: Fast response
Review.Contenu: Fast response, thank you for resolving the problem.

Review.Titre: The customer service at Liquid Web is AMAZING!

Fantastic Tech Support
Review.Contenu: After many years having dedicated servers managed by Liquid Web, I've come to expect great tech support, but today my support agent went above and beyond. He then spent more time on his own going over the server to make sure a problem like this doesn't occur again. Absolutely stellar in every way!

They are not cheap but for someone like me with limited technical knowledge, they are worth the expense.  I highly recommend Liquid Web.

Review.Titre: Patience, Kindness & Knowledgeable
Review.Contenu: I am an independent small business owner. My website is critical to my business. I’ve been a Liquid Web customer for at least ten years. I am not “technical” from a server perspective.  Yet, I know that uptime and reliability are essential.  I applaud Liquid Web for its 24 x 7 service and support. They are quick to respond and patient with customers like me, who may not understand how tech support is helping me to resolve issues with my WordPress website. Kohl was patient and kind as he shared his knowledge of what I now refer to as a “false positive critical error”.  Kohl spent as much time with me as I needed to get my questions answered and gain a sufficient understanding of the recommendations. I am grateful for the service Liquid Web provides and grateful to Kohl for taking the time to explain in non-technical terms what, how, and why.   Thank you, Kohl, and the entire Liquid Web Team! More than hosting, Liquid Web truly has the “Most Helpful Humans in Hosting”.If you want dependable hosting and helpful humans, Liquid Web is your solution.
